entry.title: Git tip 1
entry.content: By default git uses ‘less’ as a pager. You can disable it by

entry.title: Was about to hit ‘brew install git’. Then I realised I'd already have git installed
entry.content:
Do not have git on my rebuilt MBP. Was about to hit ‘brew install git’. Then I realised: I already have git installed. It is part of XCode.

So it is what I did: add the following line to .bash_rc

entry.title: Did a ‘git commit .’ but did not realised the commit has failed.
entry.content:
Did a ‘git commit .’ but did not realised the commit has failed.

Then I did a ‘git checkout -b next_jira’ and I lost all my changes… Nice.

entry.title: Try to use ``git`` on a cpython code base (which uses hg as the VCS). Was thinking: Need to come up with a ``.gitignore`` myself, probably. Turns out there is a ``.gitignore`` in the repository. Glad need not to do this extra work
entry.content: Try to use git on a cpython code base (which uses hg as the VCS). Was thinking: Need to come up with a .gitignore myself, probably. Turns out there is a .gitignore in the repository. Glad need not to do this extra work
